description:
I finally had the opportunity to explore a small brook near Cape North.  I had seen the sat imagery and spotted a few potential falls but I needed to ground truth the place.  I was in the area and set off at a dry time of the year.  This is good since the walking in the brook is easy on the huge boulders located everywhere.  Soon I came up to a huge rock set in the middle of the river with trees growing on it.  I went farther upstream and soon my reward was in front of me.  A super nice multi tier cascade type fall with a huge pool in front of it.  

I went further upstream to my second waypoint and wasn’t disappointed.  What this fall lacked in height in made up in the scenic aspect.  A slide fall drops into pool that has a huge rocky overhand...like a private hot tub with a roof!   And no, the water is not warm at all!  Then it the brook plunges a last 3 ft fall into another large pool.
directions: Cabot Trail from Neils Hbr towards Cape North.  On the way out of the park, you will cross Effies Brook.  Park outside the park and follow the brook upstream to the falls.
title: Effies Brook Falls
